I am def not the target demo for Sabrina Carpenter as a middle aged woman that primarily listens to electronica. This song is really good. The lyrics nail a very specific feeling that can happen in toxic relationships. I'll speak for myself here:  In a past toxic relationship,  was able to look away from lots of things to an extent. I could compartmentalize the bruising of my ego and heartbreak from the public embarrassment and blow to my reputation that comes with a partners bad behavior. I can't recall another song that has hit that real specific feeling. The lyrics are cleverly crafted and elevated with the bits of twang that come through. I had never heard this song outside of background music until her tiny desk show. That performance really highlighted the Country aspects of the songs she was playing, and what turned me onto this song specifically. She reminds me a little bit of Dolly in the best way possible. And now that I'm hearing this version of the song it's like a synthed out Dolly which is really cool. I never would've thought that kind of combination would work. Her harmonies are luscious too. This song has been burned into my brain for the last 72 hours. It scratches the right itches.

I'm typically a pop fan tbh and I like Sabrina's voice, but this song is incredibly irritating. I think being embarrassed of your partner has gotta be one of the biggest red flags imo. And listenting to this song makes me actively cringe because it just reminds me of incredibly toxic people who only use others as a way to prop themselves up. "If you don't fit into the friend group, you're embarrassing and I'd rather you stay in", mean girl ass behavior. And the tone just makes it seem like she couldn't give a shit less what would make him happy or what she likes about him as a person, it's just "well you're my bf now so don't embarrass me", mc syndrome. This song just makes me think she doesnt want a bf, but a pawn she can just move around her life to show off to others. Like, I genuinely can't imagine a guy making a so called "love song" about a girl and the entire song being about how he just doesnt want her to act like herself around his friends because it'll be bad for his image and ego. People would be calling it misogynistic.
This is a situation where a song didn't age badly, but one where it aged well in the worst way. I don't know if that makes sense or not.

That word seemed to be the only thing everyone was talking about when raving about how good the song is.  The wordy dird, as we used to call it in the 4th Grade or the last time cussing impressed me, seems forced into the song.  Without  the big bad the song is an amazing plea to a new lover and the lyrics stand on their own.

I spent 19 years of my life as a sex worker, letting my clients molest my nether regions in exchange for drugs, money, and clout on Snapchat. I not only found the pit of despair but also it's bottom and there I stayed thinking this is who I am and this is where I belong. I had resigned myself to this life when I first heard this song. Or maybe it heard my heart crying out for salvation? These lyrics spoke to me in a way I never dreamed possible. The words resonate with me on a spiritual, personal, and philosophical level. It was as if someone had been watching my every move from the shadows (and I'm still not totally convinced that isn't the case) and written a song about my life. I dare say that whoever wrote the lyrics is of one mind with me. The world had broken me but this song changed everything. This song made love to my spirit, nay, my soul because it spoke to the core of me. This is more than just a song, it is my anthem. The soundtrack to my life. A cornucopia of sounds and melodies that saved me. ,
